content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Advanced C2 Infrastructure, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Advanced C2 Infrastructure

content.text: This lesson covers: Domain fronting, C2 channels, Anonymization, Resilience. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Domain fronting enables attackers (or defenders) to building resilient command and control.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Advanced C2 Infrastructure daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What is domain fronting?
options: Using CDN to hide true C2 destination
post_assessment.explanation: Domain fronting uses CDNs (CloudFront, Azure CDN) to disguise C2 traffic as legitimate HTTPS connections.

post_assessment.question: Why use multiple C2 channels?
post_assessment.explanation: Multiple C2 channels provide fallback options if primary infrastructure is blocked or taken down.
